intro: Oreocharis lacerata, commonly known as the fringed orchid, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fringed petals and sepals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous forests. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, with a distinctive, elongated shape. Oreocharis lacerata is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, humid climates.
